= Misc Odoo Options

This config section convert environment variable related to misc odoo options to valid odoo CLI.

include::partial$converters/misc.adoc[]


[[option_import_partial]]
== import_partial
Use this for big data importation, if it crashes you will be able to continue at the current state.
         Provide a filename to store intermediate importation states.

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `IMPORT_PARTIAL` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_bool[bool].

Odoo cli used:

* -P
* --import-partial

[[option_pidfile]]
== pidfile
file where the server pid will be stored

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `PIDFILE` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_Path[Path].

Odoo cli used:

* --pidfile

[[option_unaccent]]
== unaccent
Try to enable the unaccent extension when creating new databases.

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `UNACCENT` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_bool[bool].

Odoo cli used:

* --unaccent

[[option_without_demo]]
== without_demo
NOTE: disable loading demo data for modules to be installed (comma-separated, use "all" for all modules).
        Requires -d and -i. Default is %default

Odoo cli used:

* --without-demo

The environment variable `WITHOUT_DEMO` is xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_repeatable[repeatable]. +
This mean a suffix can be added after an **single** `_`.
For example `WITHOUT_DEMO_value`, the suffix is `value` not `_value`


[[option_with_demo]]
== with_demo
install demo data in new databases

TIP: Only Odoo version 19.0 is supported

The environment variable `WITH_DEMO` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_bool[bool].

Odoo cli used:

* --with-demo

[[option_skip_auto_install]]
== skip_auto_install
Skip the automatic installation of modules marked as auto_install

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 17.0 until 18.0

The environment variable `SKIP_AUTO_INSTALL` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_bool[bool].

Odoo cli used:

* --skip-auto-install

[[option_data_dir]]
== data_dir
Directory where to store Odoo data

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `DATA_DIR` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_Path[Path].

Odoo cli used:

* -D
* --data-dir



== Other environment keys



[[env_ODOO_PATH]]
=== ODOO_PATH
Convert environ key=ODOO_PATH

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `ODOO_PATH` is used and expect a `Path`.

NOTE: No cli argument exist for this key


[[env_ODOO_RC]]
=== ODOO_RC
specify alternate config file

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `ODOO_RC` is used and expect a `Path`.

NOTE: No cli argument exist for this key


[[env_PIDFILE]]
=== PIDFILE
Auto set a pid file in `/tmp/odoo.pid` if the key equal `True`

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `PIDFILE` is used and expect a `bool`.

NOTE: No cli argument exist for this key


[[env_WITHOUT_DEMO]]
=== WITHOUT_DEMO
disable loading demo data for all modules if equal to true

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `WITHOUT_DEMO` is used and expect a `bool`.

NOTE: No cli argument exist for this key


[[env_STOP_AFTER_INIT]]
=== STOP_AFTER_INIT
stop the server after its initialization

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `STOP_AFTER_INIT` is used and expect a `bool`.

NOTE: No cli argument exist for this key


[[env_SAVE_CONFIG_FILE]]
=== SAVE_CONFIG_FILE
Save the generated config. Always True

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `SAVE_CONFIG_FILE` is used and expect a `bool`.

NOTE: No cli argument exist for this key


[[env_ADMIN_PASSWORD]]
=== ADMIN_PASSWORD
The Admin password for database management

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `ADMIN_PASSWORD` is used and expect a `str`.

NOTE: No cli argument exist for this key



== Only CLI args


=== Convert cli args=['--dev'] to _Const.NOT_INI_CONFIG
=== Convert cli args=['--shell-interface'] to _Const.NOT_INI_CONFIG
